CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: No phase transition was observed for all three polymers by DSC analysis up to 300 ° C. All polymers have decomposition temperature ( defined as the 5% weight - loss temperature , T d ) over 450 °C under nitrogen as determined by TGA analysis , indicating their excellent thermal stabilities.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| polymers |
| three polymers |
| nitrogen |

Three material names were identified in the paragraph: polymers, three polymers, and nitrogen.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| polymers |

The only clear material name in the paragraph is "polymers". The phrase "three polymers" is a specific subset of polymers, but it does not provide enough information to identify a specific material. Similarly, "nitrogen" is a gas and not a material in the context of this paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: No phase transition was observed for all three polymers by DSC analysis up to 300 ° C. All polymers have decomposition temperature ( defined as the 5% weight - loss temperature , T d ) over 450 °C under nitrogen as determined by TGA analysis , indicating their excellent thermal stabilities.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| phase transition |
| decomposition temperature |
| 5% weight-loss temperature, Td |
| thermal stabilities |

The "Property Name" entities in the paragraph are "phase transition", "decomposition temperature", "5% weight-loss temperature, Td", and "thermal stabilities". These entities are mentioned as properties of the polymers being discussed in the paragraph.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| decomposition temperature |
| thermal stabilities |

After reviewing the entities, I have removed "phase transition" and "5% weight-loss temperature, Td" as they do not clearly refer to material properties. "Phase transition" is a physical phenomenon, not a material property, and "5% weight-loss temperature, Td" is a specific measurement used to determine a material property, not a property itself. The remaining entities, "decomposition temperature" and "thermal stabilities", are both material properties that describe the behavior of the polymers under heat.
